meanings.definition: To pass or go before in time or place.
meanings.sent1: The early bird forepassed the other birds to reach the worm first.
meanings.sent2: The sun forepassed the moon in the sky, rising before it set.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise forepassed the hare in the race, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her determination forepassed all obstacles in her path, leading her to success.
meanings.sent5: The river forepassed the mountains, flowing ahead of them towards the valley.

meanings.definition: To surpass or excel in achievement or quality.
meanings.sent1: His artwork forepassed all others in the exhibition, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The student's grades forepassed his classmates', earning him the top spot in the class.
meanings.sent3: The chef's dish forepassed all expectations, leaving the diners amazed.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness forepassed any material possessions, making her truly rich in spirit.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's speed forepassed his opponents, securing him the victory.
